name: virtualenv
usage:
virtualenv [--version] [--with-traceback] [-v | -q] [--read-only-app-data] [--app-data APP_DATA] [--reset-app-data] [--upgrade-embed-wheels] [--discovery {builtin}] [-p py] [--try-first-with py_exe]
           [--creator {builtin,cpython3-posix,venv}] [--seeder {app-data,pip}] [--no-seed] [--activators comma_sep_list] [--clear] [--no-vcs-ignore] [--system-site-packages] [--symlinks | --copies] [--no-download | --download]
           [--extra-search-dir d [d ...]] [--pip version] [--setuptools version] [--wheel version] [--no-pip] [--no-setuptools] [--no-wheel] [--no-periodic-update] [--symlink-app-data] [--prompt prompt] [-h]
           dest

options.description: display the version of the virtualenv package and its location, then exit
on failure also display the stacktrace internals of virtualenv (default: False)
use app data folder in read-only mode (write operations will fail with error) (default: False)
a data folder used as cache by the virtualenv (default: ~/.local/share/virtualenv)
start with empty app data folder (default: False)
trigger a manual update of the embedded wheels (default: False)
show this help message and exit
increase verbosity (default: 2)
decrease verbosity (default: 0)
interpreter discovery method (default: builtin)
interpreter based on what to create environment (path/identifier) - by default use the interpreter where the tool is installed - first found wins (default: [])
try first these interpreters before starting the discovery (default: [])
create environment via (builtin = cpython3-posix) (default: builtin)
remove the destination directory if exist before starting (will overwrite files otherwise) (default: False)
don't create VCS ignore directive in the destination directory (default: False)
give the virtual environment access to the system site-packages dir (default: False)
try to use symlinks rather than copies, when symlinks are not the default for the platform (default: True)
try to use copies rather than symlinks, even when symlinks are the default for the platform (default: False)
seed packages install method (default: app-data)
do not install seed packages (default: False)
pass to disable download of the latest pip/setuptools/wheel from PyPI (default: True)
pass to enable download of the latest pip/setuptools/wheel from PyPI (default: False)
a path containing wheels to extend the internal wheel list (can be set 1+ times) (default: [])
version of pip to install as seed: embed, bundle or exact version (default: bundle)
version of setuptools to install as seed: embed, bundle or exact version (default: bundle)
version of wheel to install as seed: embed, bundle or exact version (default: bundle)
do not install pip (default: False)
do not install setuptools (default: False)
do not install wheel (default: False)
disable the periodic (once every 14 days) update of the embedded wheels (default: False)
symlink the python packages from the app-data folder (requires seed pip>=19.3) (default: False)
activators to generate - default is all supported (default: bash,cshell,fish,nushell,powershell,python)
provides an alternative prompt prefix for this environment (value of . means name of the current working directory) (default: None)

tldr:
> Create virtual isolated Python environments.
> More information: <https://virtualenv.pypa.io/>.

- Create a new environment:

`virtualenv {{path/to/venv}}`

- Customize the prompt prefix:

`virtualenv --prompt={{prompt_prefix}} {{path/to/venv}}`

- Use a different version of Python with virtualenv:

`virtualenv --python={{path/to/pythonbin}} {{path/to/venv}}`

- Start (select) the environment:

`source {{path/to/venv}}/bin/activate`

- Stop the environment:

`deactivate`
